item.title: Summoners War Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Summoners War Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Summoners War
  • How to Get More Summoners War Codes

Summoners War is an epic adventure where you need to build the best set of characters and defeat many monsters that will stand in your way. You can choose unique tactics for each battle and get valuable rewards. If you like freebies, we have a list of codes for Summoners War that will speed up your progress.

Updated December 17, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: Only one code is available, but we constantly monitor developers' social networks and other resources to find new ones. Keep coming back to this guide for more freebies.

All Summoners War Codes

How to Redeem Codes in Summoners War

There are two ways to redeem codes in Summoners War . The first allows you to do it in the game itself. As you progress through the game, this feature will be unlocked for you eventually. The second way is to do this via the website. If you don't know how to redeem codes in Summoners War , follow the guide below:

First Method

  • Launch Summoners War .
  • Once in the game, go to the Event tab. It is on the right side of the screen under resources and currency.
  • Next, select the Event tab.
  • Among the offered options, select the Enter Your Promo Code link.
  • Redeem the code.
  • Enjoy.

Second Method

  • Open your browser.
  • Visit the Summoners War Coupon Exchange website.
  • Select your Game Server.
  • Next, enter your Hive ID.
  • Now, insert the code you want to use.
  • Launch Summoners War .
  • Enjoy your reward.

How to Get More Summoners War Codes

If you want to get more codes for Summoners War , we recommend that you subscribe to the official social networks of the developers. They often add new codes for holidays or events and post them on their pages. Here are some of them:

  • Instagram
  • Twitter (X)
  • Facebook

Summoners War is available on PC, Android, and iOS.

item.title: Tales of Terrarum Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Tales of Terrarum is a strategy game where you need to build your base. Your goal is to develop a full-fledged town with mines, fields, a smithy, a farm, and other infrastructure necessary for independent functioning. Along with this, you have to create your army and conduct raids. All this requires a lot of resources and fortunately, you can get them for free by redeeming Tales of Terrarum codes from our guide.

Updated December 17, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: The codes in this guide are your key to unlocking exciting bonuses. Redeem them while they’re still active and take your gameplay to the next level.

All Tales of Terrarum Codes

Working Tales of Terrarum Codes

  • December12 - Enter this code to get exclusive rewards. (NEW)
  • atreus888 - Enter this code to get exclusive rewards.
  • FB13000 - Enter this code to get exclusive rewards.
  • DC6000 - Enter this code to get exclusive rewards.
  • FBSUNDAY1 - Enter this code to get exclusive rewards.
  • FB12000 - Enter this code to get exclusive rewards.

  • Lord777 - Enter this code to get 1x Bronze Key, 10x Gold Resin, 10x White Fox Skin, and 50x Promotional Gems.
  • Craft888888 - Enter this code to get Grant and 10x Gold Resin.
  • Gift168 - Enter this code to get 1x Uncommon Map and 5x Normal Treasure Maps.
  • Bluestacksvip - Enter this code to get 1x Silver Key, 1x Uncommon Map, 1x 1h Construction Box, and 1x 1h Resource Box.
  • SVIP777 - Enter this code to get 1x Bronze Key and 1x 2h Resource Box.
  • Trade7777 - Enter this code to get 1x Bronze Key, 1000 Adventure’s EXP, and 10x Promotional Gem.
  • FB2000 - Enter this code to get 3x Normal Treasure Maps, 1x Normal Select Castle, and 1x 15M Resource Box.

  • LISA888 - Enter this code to get Lisa, 1000 Craftsman’s EXP, and 10x Promotional Gem.

  • HAPPY1MONTH - Enter this code to get exclusive rewards.

How to Redeem Codes in Tales of Terrarum

In mobile and Roblox games, you can often redeem codes and get rewards. Usually, you can do it in a few steps and spend less than a minute. However, if you have little experience with such games, use our guide below to show you how to redeem codes in Tales of Terrarum :

  • Look at the top left corner of the screen. Click on your profile picture.
  • Select the Code option.
  • In the white field, paste the code from the list of working codes and click Confirm.

How to Get More Tales of Terrarum Codes

Just like with most free mobile games that offer freebies, bookmark this guide in your browser to get new codes as we update it regularly. You can also visit the Tales of Terrarum developers' social page:

  • Tales of Terrarum Facebook page

Tales of Terrarum is available on mobile devices.

item.title: Incredible Pokemon Art Exhibition Happening Now in Tokyo
item.description:
Summary

  • Unique Pokémon art exhibition in Tokyo features traditional Japanese crafts re-imagining familiar characters - great for all ages.
  • POKÉMON X KOGEI curated by National Crafts Museum showcases 70 original art pieces inspired by Pokémon with never-before-seen designs.
  • Original merchandise available at the exhibition includes painted plates, necklaces, plushies, pins, masks, and more, appealing to all Pokémon fans.

Quick Links

  • POKÉMON X KOGEI - Exhibition Details
    • Playful Encounters of Pokémon and Japanese Craft
  • Original Merchandise
    • Get Your Hands on Something Special

Japan has no shortage of special Pokémon events happening on a regular basis, but sometimes there are ones that stand out from the rest as being something truly special. Right now in Tokyo, such an event is happening at Azubudai Hills Gallery. An incredible and unique Pokémon art exhibition is being hosted by the gallery through the start of February, featuring artwork unlike anything ever displayed by Pokémon , and plenty of exclusive goods, too.

This art exhibition is called POKÉMON X KOGEI: Playful Encounters of Pokémon and Japanese Craft. As the title suggests, the exhibition is presenting Pokémon in a new way, through traditional Japanese craft styles that re-imagine the characters that we know so well. Because it is a combination of characters that even children recognize, and a beautiful style of art, the exhibition is great for people of all ages, including families, to enjoy together.

POKÉMON X KOGEI - Exhibition Details

Playful Encounters of Pokémon and Japanese Craft

POKÉMON X KOGEI has been curated by the National Crafts Museum, with the word "kogei" meaning traditional Japanese crafts. It features art pieces by 20 different Japanese artists, with sculpture, paintings, pottery, kimonos, and more. Everything is, of course, inspired by the world and characters in the Pokémon franchise. The official website for the exhibition describes it as,

Put Pokémon and Kogei face to face, and what sorts of chemical reactions will occur? Twenty craft artists, from a Living National Treasure to youngsters, have seriously tackled that question. Works that evoke Pokémon shapes, gestures, touch. Works that reach back into memories of video games—evolution, trade, locations for journey, super-effective moves. Plus invitations to Pokémon to become part of the vessels that adorn our daily lives and even ultra cool attire—kimono and obi clasps.

The result is about 70 works—all new creations! What will your encounter with the works lying in wait for you in the exhibition gallery bring? Thrills, rapture, grins, tremors? The power of multiplication rides again! Please enjoy the quantum leaps in beauty and technique it has generated.

All the pieces of art displayed in POKÉMON X KOGEI are original to the exhibition, and have not been featured in any previous Pokémon art galleries. For Pokémon fans who feel that they have already seen it all over the years, that makes this exhibition particularly appealing. The pieces have such original and unique designs that bring Pokémon to life in a way that no one has seen before.

Azabudai Hills Gallery is not the first venue to host POKÉMON X KOGEI. Before coming to Tokyo, the exhibition traveled around Japan in 2023 and 2024, stopping in Ichikawa Prefecture, Shiga Prefecture, and Shizuoka Prefecture. It even went overseas to the USA, and was in JAPAN HOUSE Los Angeles from July 2023 to January 2024. While the official website does not have any information regarding if Tokyo is the exhibition's last stop or not at this time, there is a chance that it will continue on to other cities (or other countries) if you cannot make it to Tokyo before February.

Original Merchandise

Get Your Hands on Something Special

No special event would be complete without original goods, and POKÉMON X KOGEI does not disappoint. Again trying to appeal across generations and to many types of people that may come to the museum, there is a huge variety of original goods for sale. For fans wanting a more traditional art gallery keepsake, there are painted plates, necklaces, coasters, and fabric buttons all inspired by works within the exhibition. There is even a limited number of special Pikachu plushies wearing a kimono with the "kōji tsunagi" traditional pattern on it.

There are also pins of some of the different sculptures, and even masking tape printed with the artwork. One original design for the merchandise features Pikachu and a Pokeball inside a circle, and this design can be found on tote bags, backpacks, cups, and more. There are also mugs and keychains available, again featuring photos of some of the pieces found in the gallery. Finally, there are auctions happening selling some original pieces by the artists who contributed to POKÉMON X KOGEI, but be warned that all the information regarding these purchases is only available in Japanese (though there is a link on the English version of the website to the Japanese page if you are interested).

What makes Pokémon events like POKÉMON X KOGEI so special is not only do they appeal to all ages, but they appeal to fans of the entire franchise. POKÉMON X KOGEI is not specific to games, anime, or cards. Instead, whether people enjoy casually playing Pokémon Sleep , own thousands of Pokémon cards, or are somewhere in between, they can enjoy the event. POKÉMON X KOGEI is full of the memorable characters that keep people coming back to the franchise over and over again, making it a special visit for all Pokémon fans.

POKÉMON X KOGEI: Playful Encounters of Pokémon and Japanese Craft will be hosted in Azabudai Hills Gallery in Tokyo, Japan until February 2nd, 2025. If you cannot make it yourself, be sure to check the official website, which has photos of and information about all the pieces of art.

Source: Official Website

item.title: Top Heroes Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
In Top Heroes , players will have to assemble a team of brave heroes and go fight the forces of evil. However, in addition to exploring new locations, you need to develop your base by building new structures and upgrading them. This requires investing quite a lot of resources. To get them faster, you should use Top Heroes codes.

Each of these codes can reward you with a number of useful items, including Recruit Vouchers and Resource Chests. But as always, their validity is limited. Therefore, if you do not want to miss out on free goodies, you should hurry to use the codes.

Updated December 17, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: Use these active codes to get valuable rewards in the game. They are easy to use and available for a limited time. Remember to visit this guide regularly.

All Top Heroes Codes

Working Top Heroes Codes

  • TH777 - Redeem this code to get 300 Diamonds and 3 Recruit Vouchers
  • 2024TOPHEROES - Redeem this code to get 5 Stone Chests, 500 Diamonds, 10 Recruit Vouchers, 5 Ruby Chests, and 5 Timber Chests
  • TopHeroes2024 - Redeem this code to get 5 Stone Chests, 2 Recruit Vouchers, 5 Meat Chests, 5 Ruby Chests, and 5 Timber Chests
  • Im1of100k - Redeem this code to get 5 Meat Chests, 5 Recruit Vouchers, and 5 Universal Speed-ups for 15 min

Expired Top Heroes Codes

  • HarvestSeason
  • SpookyTH
  • TopHeroesLive
  • CakeTime
  • ONEYEARTH
  • WATERFIGHT
  • YUMYUM
  • NANOJOURNEY
  • NewAdventure
  • CherryBlossom
  • MistletoeTH
  • SummerinTH
  • 2024TOPHEROES
  • KZ4QOGCZX5
  • EXPLORER
  • Eggcellent
  • ImYours
  • Abracadabra

As befits the RPG genre, all resources can be found while exploring locations. Some of them drop from defeated enemies, while others are obtained by chopping down trees and mining rocks. However, this process takes quite a long time. Fortunately, there is a way to save time and get many resources and other useful items, namely using Top Heroes codes.

Just a few Top Heroes codes will help you summon new characters, as well as get enough resources to upgrade buildings. However, it is important to note that after the code expires, the rewards are no longer available. Therefore, we recommend that you redeem Top Heroes codes as soon as possible, especially considering that it is quite easy to do.

How to Redeem Top Heroes Codes

Just like with Roblox codes, the rewards for using Top Heroes codes are quite valuable. In addition, the codes feature is available almost from the very beginning of the game. So, you just need to follow these steps to get your goodies:

  • Launch Top Heroes.
  • Follow the short tutorial.
  • Then, click on your profile icon in the upper left corner of the screen and go to settings.
  • After that, click on the Redeem Gift Code option.
  • Finally, enter the code and click the Confirm button to get the rewards.

How to Get More Top Heroes Codes

As is the case with many other free mobile games, the developers release new codes for Top Heroes quite often. So, you should visit the official social media of the game. There, you will find not only new codes but also news about updates and events:

  • Top Heroes Facebook page
  • Top Heroes Discord server

Top Heroes is available on mobile devices.

item.title: Marvel: 7 Best Versions Of Black Widow In Video Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Black Widow has had a diverse gaming history, from non-playable cameos in The Punisher to major roles in Marvel's Avengers .
  • In LEGO Marvel Super Heroes , Black Widow's skills are useful for puzzles and remain consistent in other LEGO Marvel games.
  • Black Widow was finally playable in Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3 , where her abilities and design were inspired by the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Natasha Romanoff, also known as the Black Widow , is one of the most iconic characters in the Marvel universe. Ever since she was introduced in Tales Of Suspense #52 in 1964, the character has had a fascinating history, bouncing from villain to hero to anti-hero as a beloved member of The Avengers in comic books, the Marvel Cinematic Universe, and video games.

The super spy has appeared in many games since the start of the twenty-first century, featured as both a playable and non-playable character in action games set in the Marvel universe. She features many of the same skills and abilities, but each game finds different ways of bringing them as well as her personality and story to life to help the games stand out.

7 The Punisher

Black Widow Making Her First Appearance In A Video Game

The first time Black Widow appeared in a video game was in The Punisher , a game from 2005. While she is not playable, it was impressive to see Marvel attempt to take a character like the Punisher and fit him into a wider Marvel universe, with Director Nick Fury of S.H.I.E.L.D., Daredevil, Iron Man, and Black Widow as secondary characters.

Black Widow joins The Punisher in the game's story briefly and the ties to other Marvel properties combined with Thomas Jane reprising the role of the titular anti-hero add flavor to an already enjoyable game. The Punisher is a brutal third-person shooter game that went unappreciated for years but has since gained a cult following.

6 Marvel Vs. Capcom: Infinite

Natasha Romanoff Shined As A DLC Character

Fans were not overly impressed with Marvel Vs. Capcom: Infinite at first, but there were highlights and one of them was Black Widow. She was one of several characters added as DLC for the game and her arsenal of attacks heavily emphasized tasing enemies via her Widow's Sting, a common ability in most games.

Black Widow is fast and deadly, which should be no surprise given that is what she is known for in the comics. One of her most effective skills in Marvel Vs. Capcom: Infinite is her grapple hook, which she can use to return to the ground quickly to avoid an aerial attack or deal damage from above.

5 LEGO Marvel Super Heroes

It's Hard To Go Wrong With LEGO Characters

There is not much to Black Widow in LEGO Marvel Super Heroes as many characters feel similar aside from one or two abilities or skills. Black Widow has her dual pistols and invisibility to fit her super spy gimmick, which is useful for certain puzzles through the open-world Marvel experience, featuring the Avengers, X-Men, Fantastic Four, and more.

If any Black Widow fans want to continue the experience after LEGO Marvel Super Heroes , she plays mostly the same in both LEGO Marvel's Avengers and LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 . The only major changes are the different designs, with some based on the comics and others more inspired by the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

4 Disney Infinity

Marvel Heroes Were A Highlight Of The Experimental Game

Disney Infinity helped define the short-lived Toys-To-Life gimmick that games like Skylanders and LEGO Dimensions experimented with. In the second wave of characters focusing on Marvel heroes and villains, Black Widow was one of the first, and she has unique skills to have fun with in the vast toy box-like world as well as the various stories that can be played.

The lines of Disney Infinity toys were discontinued, but thankfully, Disney Infinity and its waves can be purchased digitally as one of the best Disney games. This way, Black Widow can still be experienced, wielding her toy guns, invisibility, and more in not just Marvel adventures, but in various other levels and maps for the ultimate Disney crossover.

3 Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order

It Only Took A Third Game Before Natasha Was Playable

For the first time in the beloved series, Black Widow was a playable character in Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order . In the first two games, she was at bases for players to talk to or receive missions from, but in the third entry of the beloved dungeon-crawling franchise, she was not only playable but was given a modern redesign, partially inspired by the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

In Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3 , Black Widow has her signature stinger bracers, escrima sticks, and firearms that make her a famous agent of S.H.I.E.L.D. and an Avenger. Her abilities are fun and Laura Bailey continues to be to Black Widow what Steve Blum is to Wolverine.

2 Marvel Rivals

Widowmaker Players Can Adjust To Her With Ease

As a hero shooter, Marvel Rivals has many characters similar to Overwatch , but Black Widow is interesting because Widowmaker is already inspired by Black Widow. So, it feels fitting that Natasha is equipped with a trusty grapple hook and sniper rifle, just like Widowmaker.

The similarities do not ruin Black Widow in the PvP shooter, however, with the character still being fun to play as a Strategist class character. With proper precision from a player, Natasha can be one of the deadliest characters in Marvel Rivals , especially when given her Team-Up ability with Hawkeye and her special skills.

1 Marvel's Avengers

This Version Of The Character Deserved Her Own Game

While Marvel's Avengers was not the epic looter RPG Crystal Dynamics and Square Enix were hoping for, the gameplay and performances of the Avengers themselves were the highlights. Black Widow was a fan-favorite for her multifaceted style, mixing various forms of martial arts, gadgets, and melee weapons, including a grappling hook that allowed her to zip across the map.

Even in the story mode, Laura Bailey excelled in her performance, as she had already been a go-to voice for Black Widow for years. Natasha proved to be the most loyal Avenger, working behind the scenes to bring all the heroes back together with the help of Ms. Marvel. Fans liked this portrayal so much, that some wished for Laura Bailey to get a spin-off title.
